DataElement.preferredName: Behavior Assessment System for Children Self-Report of Personality, College Version School Maladjustment Scale T-Score Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Numeric representation of the T-score for the School Maladjustment Scale in the Behavior Assessment System for Children, College Version, Self-Report of Personality Form.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Behavior Assessment System for Children Self-Report of Personality, College Version School Maladjustment Scale T-Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A comprehensive set of rating scales designed to facilitate the differential diagnosis and classification of a variety of emotional and behavioral disorders of children, aid in the design of treatment plans, and provide insight into an individual's thoughts and feelings._The Self-Report of Personality, College Version provides insight into the thoughts and feelings of college-aged individuals (ages 18 to 25)._A rating scale included in the Behavior Assessment System for Children, College Version that provides an indication of how the subject is responding to the academic demands of college._A method for converting an individual score into a standard form. While similar to a z-score, t-score is used when the conversion is made without knowledge of the population standard deviation and mean.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Behavior Assessment System for Children Self-Report of Personality, College Version
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A comprehensive set of rating scales designed to facilitate the differential diagnosis and classification of a variety of emotional and behavioral disorders of children, aid in the design of treatment plans, and provide insight into an individual's thoughts and feelings.:The Self-Report of Personality, College Version provides insight into the thoughts and feelings of college-aged individuals (ages 18 to 25).

Concepts.longName: Behavior Assessment System for Children, Second Edition
Concepts.definition: A comprehensive set of rating scales designed to facilitate the differential diagnosis and classification of a variety of emotional and behavioral disorders of children, aid in the design of treatment plans, and provide insight into an individual's thoughts and feelings.
The Self-Report of Personality, College Version provides insight into the thoughts and feelings of college-aged individuals (ages 18 to 25).

Property.preferredDefinition: A rating scale included in the Behavior Assessment System for Children, College Version that provides an indication of how the subject is responding to the academic demands of college.:A method for converting an individual score into a standard form. While similar to a z-score, t-score is used when the conversion is made without knowledge of the population standard deviation and mean.

Concepts.definition: A rating scale included in the Behavior Assessment System for Children, College Version that provides an indication of how the subject is responding to the academic demands of college.

A method for converting an individual score into a standard form. While similar to a z-score, t-score is used when the conversion is made without knowledge of the population standard deviation and mean.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Versioned to remove edition reference. mc 5/2/16

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A numerical quantity that represents the conversion of an individual score into a standard form made without knowledge of the population standard deviation and mean.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.
